ud1.8:0.2: For some context on why the Buddha _praised_ the monk in this Sutta—which is likely to seem outrageous even to Buddhists—see [AN 3.110](https://suttas.hillsidehermitage.org/?q=an3.110), [Iti 80](https://suttas.hillsidehermitage.org/?q=iti80), and [AN 8.53](https://suttas.hillsidehermitage.org/?q=an8.53).
ud1.8:8.3: A play on words: Saṅgāmaji, the bhikkhus’s name, means “victorious in battle”, while “freed from bonds” is _saṅgā muttaṃ_. The lines can also be read as: “[One who is] victorious in battle [against defilements], freed from bonds—him I call a brahmin.”
